cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi (155 km) west of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering slowly west-southwest and south over the southern Bay of Campeche through mid-week; forecast cone then turns the system northward into the central Gulf late in the 5-day period.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Bay of Campeche coast (Campeche–Tabasco–Veracruz area, Mexico)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – Ottawa Port District, IL is hundreds of miles inland and will not experience an offshore exit of this cyclone within 5-days.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for U.S.; Tropical Storm Watch not issued. (Current warning area is Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, MX).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico (Tropical Storm Warning).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche shoreline in Mexico.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed near Illinois; wind-probability table only provides Mexican coastal points.
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at the port during the 5-day outlook
weather_observation.wind: None – no tropical-storm-force winds forecast to reach Illinois within 5 days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – inland river port, far from coast and outside surge influence.
weather_observation.rainfall: None – heavy rainfall confined to Mexico/Central America in current outlook.
